ripsapBaseRipOperState.name: ripsapBaseRipOperState
ripsapBaseRipOperState.description: Indicates the operational state of RIP.

ripsapBaseSapOperState.name: ripsapBaseSapOperState
ripsapBaseSapOperState.description: Indicates the operational state of SAP.

ripIfEntry.name: ripIfEntry
ripIfEntry.description: Each entry corresponds to one interface known to the system.

ripIfIndex.name: ripIfIndex
ripIfIndex.description: The identifier of this interface, unique within the instance of RIP. This value corresponds to the interface identifier found in ipxIfIndex.

ripIfAdminState.name: ripIfAdminState
ripIfAdminState.description: The desired state of the interface.

ripIfOperState.name: ripIfOperState
ripIfOperState.description: The current operational state of the interface. If ripIfAdminState is disabled(1) then ripIfOperState should be down(1). If ripIfAdminState is changed to enabled(2) then ripIfOperState should change to up(2) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic; it should change to sleeping(3) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incomming connection); it should remain in the down(1) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(2) state.

ripIfUpdateMode.name: ripIfUpdateMode
ripIfUpdateMode.description: The RIP update mechanism used on this interface. None(2) is used for static routes configurations. AutoStatic(3) means that the local router can issue an update request to the remote router and the response will be kept statically in the routing database as auto static routes. Standard(1) is the periodic broadcast RIP mechanism.

ripIfUpdateInterval.name: ripIfUpdateInterval
ripIfUpdateInterval.description: The RIP update interval, in sec. For Standard(1) ripIfUpdateMode, this is the interval with which periodic update broadcasts are sent, for AutoStatic(3) ripIfUpdateMode, this is the maximum interval for which router will listen for rip announcements, not used for None(2) ripIfUpdateMode

ripIfAgeMultiplier.name: ripIfAgeMultiplier
ripIfAgeMultiplier.description: The holding multiplier for routes received in RIP periodic updates (applies only if ripIfUpdateMode is Standard(1)).

ripIfSupply.name: ripIfSupply
ripIfSupply.description: Enable sending of RIP updates (change and periodic) on this interface.

ripIfListen.name: ripIfListen
ripIfListen.description: Enable listening to RIP updates on this interface.

ripIfOutPackets.name: ripIfOutPackets
ripIfOutPackets.description: The number of RIP packets sent on this interface.

ripIfInPackets.name: ripIfInPackets
ripIfInPackets.description: The number of RIP packets received on this interface.

sapIfEntry.name: sapIfEntry
sapIfEntry.description: Each entry corresponds to one interface known to the system.

sapIfIndex.name: sapIfIndex
sapIfIndex.description: The identifier of this interface, unique within the instance of SAP. This value corresponds to the interface identifier found in ipxIfIndex.

sapIfAdminState.name: sapIfAdminState
sapIfAdminState.description: The desired state of the interface.

sapIfOperState.name: sapIfOperState
sapIfOperState.description: The current operational state of the interface. If sapIfAdminState is disabled(1) then ripIfOperState should be down(1). If sapIfAdminState is changed to enabled(2) then sapIfOperState should change to up(2) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic; it should change to sleeping(3) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incomming connection); it should remain in the down(1) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(2) state.

sapIfUpdateMode.name: sapIfUpdateMode
sapIfUpdateMode.description: The SAP update mechanism used on this interface. None(2) is used for static routes configurations. AutoStatic(3) means that the local router can issue an update request to the remote router and the response will be kept statically in the routing database as auto static services. Standard(1) is the periodic broadcast SAP mechanism.

sapIfUpdateInterval.name: sapIfUpdateInterval
sapIfUpdateInterval.description: The SAP update interval, in sec. For Standard(1) ripIfUpdateMode, this is the interval with which periodic update broadcasts are sent, for AutoStatic(3) sapIfUpdateMode, this is the maximum interval for which router will listen for rip announcements. Not used for None (2) sapIfUpdateMode

sapIfAgeMultiplier.name: sapIfAgeMultiplier
sapIfAgeMultiplier.description: The holding multiplier for services received in SAP periodic updates (applies only if sapIfUpdateMode is Standard(1)).

sapIfSupply.name: sapIfSupply
sapIfSupply.description: Enable sending of SAP updates (change and periodic) on this interface.

sapIfListen.name: sapIfListen
sapIfListen.description: Enable listening to SAP updates on this interface.

sapIfGetNearestServerReply.name: sapIfGetNearestServerReply
sapIfGetNearestServerReply.description: Indicates whether to respond to SAP get nearest server requests received on this interface.

sapIfOutPackets.name: sapIfOutPackets
sapIfOutPackets.description: The number of SAP packets sent on this interface.

sapIfInPackets.name: sapIfInPackets
sapIfInPackets.description: The number of SAP packets received on this interface.
